title: Recent agents history and revival system
description:
Add ability to save and restore past agent tmux sessions. When an agent window is created, save its working directory and name to persistent storage. Provide UI to browse recent agents and easily revive them. Include clear/delete functionality for managing history.

Key requirements:
- Persist agent metadata (name, working directory, creation time, last used)
- Storage location: ~/.config/agent-tmux/history.json or similar
- Browse view showing recent agents with revival option
- Clear individual entries or entire history
- Consider: max history size, deduplication, sorting (recent first vs alphabetical)
notes:
Subtasks:
- agent-tmux-2fg: Design storage schema (first)
- agent-tmux-dkp: Implement read/write operations (depends on schema)
- agent-tmux-3hn: Hook agent creation to save (depends on r/w ops)
- agent-tmux-wyp: Add recent agents to 'sessions' TUI (depends on r/w ops)
- agent-tmux-eda: Add CLI history commands (depends on r/w ops)
- agent-tmux-e2p: Add 'open' command for quick access (depends on r/w ops)
close_reason: Epic complete: history package, CLI commands, session hooks, sessions TUI with Recent section, and open command all implemented

title: Design agent history storage schema and location
description: Decide on storage format (JSON, SQLite, etc.) and location (~/.config/agent-tmux/ or ~/.local/share/agent-tmux/). Define schema for agent entries: name, working_directory, created_at, last_used_at, session_name. Consider versioning for future schema changes.

title: Browse input history should include unsent entries
description: In the browse panel, Up/Down should navigate input history. History should include entries that were typed and then cleared/deleted, even if never submitted.
notes: Capture cleared drafts in input history when user deletes to empty (store last non-deletion value).

title: Hook agent creation to save history entry
description: When 'agent-tmux start' or similar creates a new agent session, automatically save an entry to history. Update last_used_at when attaching to an existing agent. Deduplicate by name+workdir combination.
close_reason: Implemented history hooks for session create/attach in root.go and sessions.go

title: Audit codebase and update README/AGENTS with up-to-date feature info
description: Review current features, update README and possibly AGENTS.md to reflect latest capabilities and usage.

title: list-sessions should be a synonym for sessions
close_reason: Already implemented - cmd/sessions.go line 13 defines Aliases: []string{"lsessions", "list-sessions"}

title: Sessions should show memory use per window/tab
description: In the sessions TUI, display memory usage for each window/pane (if possible), similar to choose-tree, alongside the session list.

title: Investigate/fix non-working SEND, ESC, ATT buttons
description: The SEND, ESC, and ATT buttons in the tree view don't seem to work when clicked. Need to investigate whether this is a button zone calculation issue, mouse event handling, or something else. Consider whether buttons are even necessary given keyboard shortcuts exist.
close_reason: Fixed two bugs: (1) Y-offset for button zones was off by 1 (used inputHeight+2 instead of inputHeight+1), and (2) button zones were being calculated in View() which doesn't persist changes. Moved button zone calculation to calculateButtonZones() called from Update() after state changes.

title: Browse mode should not block tmux mouse window switching
description: When the browse interface is active with mouse support, tmux window switching via mouse clicks on the status bar should still work. The browse UI should coexist with tmux mouse mode instead of consuming all mouse events.
notes: Disable mouse by default when running inside tmux (TMUX env set) so tmux status bar/window clicks work; mouse can be toggled on with M.

title: Browse hierarchy should support collapsing sections
description: In the browse left pane, allow collapsing/expanding sections of the hierarchy to reduce noise and focus on relevant branches.
notes: Mouse click on expand/collapse icon toggles session/window expansion.

title: Browse session preview should preserve pane colors/formatting
description: The small session preview shown in the browse window should preserve the original pane's colors and formatting (styles), not render in a simplified/flat style.
notes: Capture pane preview with ANSI escape sequences to preserve colors/formatting.

title: Implement agent history read/write operations
description: Create history package with functions: LoadHistory(), SaveEntry(agent), DeleteEntry(id), ClearHistory(). Handle file creation, locking for concurrent access, and error cases. Include max history limit (e.g., 100 entries) with LRU eviction.
close_reason: Implemented history package with SQLite storage, full CRUD operations, LRU eviction, and comprehensive tests

title: Add 'open' command for quick session access
description:
Create new 'agent-tmux open' command that provides a streamlined TUI for starting/resuming agent sessions:

1. **Start New Session** option at top - runs 'agent-tmux init' flow
2. **Recent/suggested sessions** list below - from history

This is a simplified alternative to 'sessions' focused on getting into an agent quickly rather than managing all tmux sessions.

Should support:
- Keyboard navigation
- Quick select by number (1, 2, 3...)
- Search/filter recent sessions
notes: Update UX: main open view should page between currently-open sessions and suggested/recent sessions (default to open). Open command exists elsewhere, so this view should prioritize active sessions.
close_reason: Added 'open' command with tabbed Active/Recent view and number shortcuts

title: Add history management commands
description:
Add CLI commands for history management:
- 'agent-tmux history list' - show recent agents
- 'agent-tmux history clear' - clear all history  
- 'agent-tmux history remove <name>' - remove specific entry
- Consider --json flag for scripting
close_reason: Added history list/clear/remove commands with --json flag

title: Move keyboard shortcut hints away from input bar
description: Keyboard shortcuts like [r]efresh [a]ttach don't work when input is focused, but the hints are displayed right next to the input box. Move the hints to be displayed either above or below the left tree panel where they're contextually accurate.
close_reason: Moved keyboard shortcut hints from input bar to status bar. Now shows context-sensitive hints: general shortcuts when not in input, input-specific hints (Enter/Esc) when in input mode.

title: Browse panes should be resizable via mouse
description: In the browse UI, allow resizing between the tree and preview panes via mouse drag on the divider, similar to tmux pane resizing. No keyboard-specific resizing required.
notes: Implemented mouse drag resizing for tree/preview divider in browse UI.

title: Run session commands as a popup by default
description: Session command execution should default to a tmux popup instead of a pane, unless configured otherwise.
close_reason: Implemented popup default for sessions and browse commands

title: Browse input clearing and exit behavior
description: While focus is in the browse input: Esc clears the current input; Ctrl-C clears the input if non-empty; pressing Ctrl-C twice exits the browse panel.
notes: Implemented Esc/Ctrl-C input clearing and double Ctrl-C exit behavior in browse input.

title: Escape in input should switch focus to tree panel
description: Currently pressing Escape in the input panel clears the input but doesn't change focus. It should also switch focus to the tree panel so that keyboard shortcuts become immediately usable without needing to press Tab.
close_reason: Escape in input now: (1) clears input if non-empty, (2) switches focus to tree panel if input is empty

title: Add recent agents view to sessions TUI
description:
Add a 'Recent' section to the 'agent-tmux sessions' TUI showing saved agent history. Display name, working directory, last used time. Allow selecting an entry to revive/create that agent session.

**Layout requirement:** Recent/saved sessions should appear BELOW the currently open sessions in the tree view. The hierarchy should be:
1. Open sessions (current tmux sessions)
2. Recent agents (saved history, not currently running)

This keeps active sessions prominent while providing easy access to revival.
close_reason: Added Recent section to sessions TUI with revival support

title: Add onboard command for first-time user guidance
description: Create an 'agent-tmux onboard' command that guides first-time users through setup and key features. After implementation, the landing page should link to this command at the bottom.
close_reason: Implemented onboard command with quick-start guide, session structure, project config examples, and all commands. Landing page now links to it.
